author: lgo
msg: * STATUS: Vote for r33447, approving.

author: lgo
msg: Reuse opened ra_sessions where possible during merge.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(ensure_ra_session_url): New function.
(do_merge): When merging from multiple merge sources, reuse the open sessions
when the sources are from the same repository.
(populate_remaining_ranges): Reuse the ra_session passed into this function.

author: rhuijben
msg: Use a new filename instead of retrying when opening a unique temporary file
fails on Windows. This removes my favorite example of why retry loops
are evil.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c
(file_open): Add retry_on_failure argument and only call the
WIN32_RETRY_LOOP if its value is TRUE.
(svn_io_open_unique_file2): Call file_open() with retry_on_failure false to
retry with a new name on failure.
(svn_io_file_open): Call file_open with retry_on_failure true to keep the
original behavior.
Found by: Dirck Blaskey <listtarget2{_AT_}danbala.com>

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/mergeinfo.c
(svn_client__get_wc_mergeinfo): Following up on merging the svn_dirent
support, replace this local copy of calculating whether a path is
absolute with a call to svn_dirent_is_absolute.

author: danielsh
msg: Fix find_copyfrom_information_upstairs() on Windows.  This is
a re-implementation of r33211, and follows up to r33201 and r33212.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/copy.c
(svn_dirent_uri.h):  Include.
(get_copyfrom_url_rev_via_parent):
Call svn_dirent_is_ancestor() instead of svn_path_is_ancestor().
* subversion/tests/cmdline/copy_tests.py
(test_list):
Expect 'find_copyfrom_information_upstairs' to pass on all platforms.
